meanings.definition: To present as a gift or honor.
meanings.sent1: She bestowed a beautiful necklace on her best friend.
meanings.sent2: The king bestowed a medal upon the brave soldier.
meanings.sent3: The cat bestowed a dead mouse as a 'gift' on the doorstep.
meanings.sent4: The sun bestowed its warm rays upon the garden, bringing life to the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The magician bestowed a magical wand upon the young apprentice.

meanings.sent1: The teacher bestowed knowledge upon her students.
meanings.sent2: The charity bestowed food to the hungry families in need.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine bestowed a bag of chips instead of the selected snack.
meanings.sent4: The clouds bestowed rain upon the parched land, bringing relief to the farmers.
meanings.sent5: The kind stranger bestowed a warm smile to everyone she met.

meanings.sent1: The university bestowed an honorary degree upon the renowned scientist.
meanings.sent2: The judge bestowed justice upon the innocent defendant.
meanings.sent3: The lottery ticket bestowed a small prize to the surprised winner.
meanings.sent4: The ancient artifact bestowed mysterious powers upon its discoverer.
meanings.sent5: The fairy godmother bestowed a wish upon the kind-hearted girl.
